ground_truth: The camera pulls back, revealing the blood-stained butcher knife in his hand, then further back. Mother and Father stare at the POV, at first in puzzlement, then slow, growing horror. Craning up past his parents standing there, up from the neighbor's house to a high shot of the neighborhood as the sounds of police sirens rise in the distance. Two headlights appear in the darkness, backlighting the rain that pours down on a lonely strip of highway. A station wagon hisses along the wet road surface. Next to her in the passenger seat is Sam Loomis, a clinical psychiatrist. Marion, 30, drives. He is a tough-looking man in his forties who flips through pages in a manila folder. Loomis glances at Marion as she lights a cigarette. She shoves the matches into the pack and tosses it on the dashboard. Loomis stares at the cigarette pack. They look up ahead. Standing by the side of the road is a male patient, a wild-looking man in his sixties dressed in a white gown, who stares at the station wagon. Marion slows the station wagon and pulls off to the side of the road. Loomis jumps out. Through the windshield we see Loomis rush over to the patient, stand and talk for a moment, then hurry back. Camera moves with Laurie as she walks down the residential street. She carries a large bundle of school books in her arms. Across a backyard Tommy Doyle, an eight-year-old boy with tousled brown hair and bright blue eyes, comes running with his books. He catches up with her, and they walk along down the street. They walk up to the front of the old, two-story Myers house set back from the street. Laurie holds up a key. Laurie walks through the front gate and starts up toward the porch. Laurie strolls up to the front porch. She bends down, lifts the welcome mat, and places the key under it. Through a frost window, we see Laurie bending over the welcome mat. Suddenly a dark shape, the outline of a man, leans forward, watching her. As she walks back to Tommy at the street, the shape moves to watch them, then fades back into the interior of the house. Laurie and Tommy continue walking down the street. Tommy breaks stride and runs across the street. We see Laurie walking off down the street in the distance. Close to camera, the dark shape moves into frame, watching Laurie disappear around the corner. Loomis reaches a car and unlocks it. Loomis gets in the car. Loomis starts up the car and pulls away from the sanitarium. Wynn watches him go, then hurries back into the building. Laurie sits at the back of a classroom of high school students.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The camera draws back, disclosing the blood-spattered cleaver in his hand, then further back. Mother and Father gaze at the POV, at first in bewilderment, then gradual, mounting terror. Stretching up past his parents standing there, up from the neighbor's dwelling to a high shot of the vicinity as the noises of police sirens ascend in the distance. Two headlights emerge in the gloom, illuminating the rain that descends on a solitary strip of highway. A station wagon sizzles along the damp road surface. Next to her in the passenger seat is Sam Loomis, a clinical psychiatrist. Marion, 30, drives. He is a rugged-looking man in his forties who flips through pages in a manila folder. Loomis peeks at Marion as she ignites a cigarette. She thrusts the matches into the pack and tosses it on the dashboard. Loomis stares at the cigarette pack. They look up ahead. Standing by the side of the road is a male patient, a feral-looking man in his sixties dressed in a white gown, who gazes at the station wagon. Marion slows the station wagon and pulls off to the side of the road. Loomis leaps out. Through the windshield we see Loomis dash over to the patient, stand and converse for a minute, then hurry back. Camera shifts with Laurie as she walks down the residential avenue. She carries a large bundle of school books in her arms. Across a backyard Tommy Doyle, an eight-year-old boy with tousled brown hair and vivid blue eyes, comes running with his books. He catches up with her, and they stroll along down the street. They walk up to the facade of the old, two-story Myers house set back from the street. Laurie holds up a key. Laurie walks through the front gate and proceeds up toward the porch. Laurie ambles up to the front porch. She bends down, raises the welcome mat, and places the key under it. Through a frosted window, we see Laurie bending over the welcome mat. Suddenly a dark figure, the outline of a man, leans forward, observing her. As she walks back to Tommy at the street, the figure shifts to watch them, then fades back into the interior of the house. Laurie and Tommy continue strolling down the street. Tommy breaks stride and runs across the street. We see Laurie walking off down the street in the distance. Close to camera, the dark figure moves into frame, observing Laurie disappear around the corner. Loomis reaches a vehicle and unlocks it. Loomis gets in the vehicle. Loomis starts up the vehicle and pulls away from the sanitarium. Wynn watches him depart, then hurries back into the structure. Laurie sits at the back of a classroom of high school students.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The camera pulls back, revealing the blood-stained butcher knife in his hand, then further back. The parents stare at the POV with puzzlement, then growing horror. The view cranes up from them, over the neighbor's house, to a high shot of the neighborhood as police sirens wail faintly. Headlights pierce the darkness, illuminating rain on a lonely highway. A station wagon hisses along the wet road. Marion, 30, drives, with clinical psychiatrist Sam Loomis, in his forties, flipping through a manila folder beside her. Marion lights a cigarette and tosses the pack on the dashboard, catching Loomisâ€™s gaze. Ahead, a wild-looking male patient in his sixties stands by the road, staring at their car. Marion pulls over, and Loomis jumps out, speaks to the patient, then hurries back. The camera follows Laurie walking down a residential street, holding school books. Eight-year-old Tommy Doyle catches up, and they walk to the old Myers house. Laurie uses a key, lifts the welcome mat, and places it underneath as a dark shape watches her. Laurie and Tommy continue, Tommy runs across the street. Laurie walks farther down; the dark shape watches her vanish around the corner. Loomis reaches a car, unlocks it, gets in, and drives away from the sanitarium. Wynn watches him leave, then returns inside. Laurie sits in the back of a high school classroom.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The camera reveals a bloody butcher knife in his hand. Mother and Father stare in horror. The view cranes up past them, over the neighborhood as police sirens sound. Two headlights backlight the rain on a highway. A station wagon moves along. Marion, 30, drives with Sam Loomis, a psychiatrist, next to her. Loomis, in his forties, glances at Marion as she lights a cigarette and tosses the matches. A wild-looking male patient in his sixties appears by the road. Marion stops. Loomis jumps out, talks to the patient, then returns. The camera follows Laurie on a residential street, books in hand. Tommy Doyle, an eight-year-old boy, joins her. They approach the old Myers house. Laurie places a key under the welcome mat. Through the frosted window, a dark shape watches her. Laurie and Tommy continue down the street. The dark shape observes them. Loomis reaches his car, starts it, and drives away. Wynn watches him leave. Laurie sits in a high school classroom.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The camera slowly pulls back, gradually revealing the blood-stained butcher knife that is gripped tightly in his hand. It pulls back even further, capturing the unfolding scene. Mother and Father stand there, staring at the point of view with expressions that initially show puzzlement but then slowly morph into a growing sense of horror. The camera cranes upward, moving past the figures of his parents who remain standing there, tracing up from the neighborâ€™s house to a high-angle shot of the neighborhood as the ominous sounds of police sirens begin to rise in the distance. In the darkness, two headlights emerge, illuminating the rain that steadily pours down on a solitary strip of highway. A station wagon can be seen, hissing quietly as it moves along the slick, wet road surface. Seated next to her in the passenger seat is Sam Loomis, a clinical psychiatrist. Marion, a woman in her thirties, is driving the vehicle. Sam is a tough-looking man in his forties, leafing through the pages of a manila folder with focused intent. Loomis glances over at Marion as she lights up a cigarette. She forcefully shoves the matches back into the pack and carelessly tosses it onto the dashboard. Loomis continues to stare at the cigarette pack. They both look up ahead. A male patient stands by the side of the road, a wild-looking man in his sixties dressed in a stark white gown, staring intently at the station wagon. Marion begins to slow the vehicle and carefully pulls over to the side of the road. Loomis quickly jumps out. Through the windshield, we observe Loomis as he rushes over to the patient, stands and talks to him for a moment, and then hurries back. The camera transitions to follow Laurie as she walks down the residential street. She carries a large bundle of school books in her arms, cradling them as she goes. Across an adjacent backyard, Tommy Doyle, an eight-year-old boy with tousled brown hair and bright blue eyes, comes running toward her, holding his books. He catches up with her, and they continue walking side by side down the street. They approach the front of the old, two-story Myers house that sits set back from the street. Laurie holds up a key in her hand. She walks through the front gate and starts up toward the porch, strolling up to the front entrance. She bends down, lifts the welcome mat, and discreetly places the key underneath it. Through a frost-covered window, we see Laurie bending over the welcome mat. Suddenly, a dark silhouette, the outline of a man, leans forward, closely watching her actions. As she walks back to join Tommy at the street, the shadowy figure moves to observe them, then gradually fades back into the hidden interior of the house. Laurie and Tommy continue their walk down the street. Tommy suddenly breaks stride and runs across the street. We watch Laurie walking off into the distance, down the street. Close to the camera, the dark shape moves into the frame, closely watching Laurie as she disappears around the corner. Loomis reaches his car and unlocks it, then gets in. Starting the engine, Loomis pulls away from the sanitarium. Wynn watches him leave, and then hurries back into the building. Laurie sits quietly at the back of a classroom filled with high school students.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
The camera, with a deliberate and gradual motion, begins to pull back. It slowly unveils the scene, starting with the sight of a butcher knife that is unmistakably stained with blood and tightly gripped in his hand. Continuing its backward movement, the camera captures more of the developing situation as it unfolds. Standing at the scene are Mother and Father, looking directly toward the viewpoint of the camera, their expressions initially masked with puzzlement that soon evolve into a gradually intensifying sense of horror. The camera's lens cranes upwards, moving past the figures of his parents, who remain fixed in their positions. It traces upwards from their figures to the neighborâ€™s house, eventually reaching a high-angle perspective that offers a view of the entire neighborhood. In the background, the ominous and escalating sounds of police sirens echo as they begin to resonate from a distance. 

In the enveloping darkness, a pair of headlights emerge. They cut through the rain that is steadily pouring down on a lonely stretch of highway. It becomes clear that a station wagon is moving along, emitting a quiet hissing sound as it travels across the slick, wet surface of the road. Inside the vehicle, seated in the passenger seat next to her is Sam Loomis, a clinical psychiatrist by profession. Marion, a woman appearing to be in her thirties, is at the wheel, driving. Sam, a rugged and tough-looking man in his forties, is deeply absorbed in leafing through the pages of a manila folder, his focus intense. He steals a glance over at Marion, who is lighting up a cigarette. She then vigorously shoves the matches back into their pack and carelessly tosses it onto the dashboard, an action that captures Loomis's attention as he continues to stare at the cigarette pack. Both of them look forward, gazing intently down the road. 

There appears a male patient standing by the roadside, an untamed-looking man appearing to be in his sixties, dressed in a stark white gown, with his intense gaze fixed on the station wagon. Marion reacts by slowly decelerating the car and carefully maneuvering it to the roadside. Loomis makes his exit quickly, jumping out of the car with urgency. Through the windshield, we observe Loomis as he races toward the patient, pausing to converse with him briefly before he hurries back. The camera transitions, smoothly following Laurie as she walks along a residential street. She is cradling a large bundle of school books in her arms, carrying them carefully as she moves. 

Across an adjacent backyard, Tommy Doyle, an eight-year-old boy with tousled brown hair and notably bright blue eyes, rushes toward her, holding his own books. He eventually catches up to her, and together, they continue their walk side by side along the street. Their path leads them to the front of the old, two-story Myers house, which sits set back from the street. Laurie raises a key in her hand, indicating her intention. She walks through the front gate and makes her way toward the porch, eventually reaching the front entrance. There, she bends down, lifting the welcome mat, and discreetly places the key underneath it. Through a window covered in frost, we catch a glimpse of Laurie as she bends over the welcome mat. Unexpectedly, a dark silhouette, the outline of a man, leans forward, intensely observing her actions. As Laurie returns to join Tommy at the street, the shadowy figure continues to watch before gradually retreating back into the unseen interior of the house. 

Laurie and Tommy resume their walk down the street. Suddenly, Tommy breaks away from their stride and dashes across the street. We continue to watch Laurie, who walks into the distance, disappearing down the street. Near the camera, a dark shape enters the frame, closely scrutinizing Laurie as she eventually vanishes around the corner. Loomis reaches his car, unlocking it and getting inside. He starts the engine and then drives away from the sanitarium. Eyes fixed on his departure, Wynn watches him leave, before hurrying back into the building. Laurie finds herself seated quietly at the back of a classroom filled with high school students, lost in thought.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The scene begins with the camera slowly pulling back to unveil a blood-stained butcher knife held firmly in his hand. As it continues to pull back, we're introduced to a growing panorama where Mother and Father are seen standing still, their eyes locked onto the point of view. Initially, their expressions are marked by puzzlement, which gradually transforms into a slow, dawning horror as they continue to stare. The camera tilts upwards, shifting past the parents who remain standing motionless, and travels further up from the neighbor's house. It ascends to a high vantage point, capturing an expansive view of the entire neighborhood below. Meanwhile, in the distance, the faint yet distinct sounds of police sirens begin to rise, adding an ominous layer to the unfolding scene. As night envelops a lonely stretch of highway, two headlights pierce through the darkness, backlighting the relentless rain that cascades down. The camera reveals a station wagon moving steadily along the slick, wet road surface. Inside the vehicle, seated in the passenger seat, is Sam Loomis, a clinical psychiatrist marked by his tough demeanor, deep into his forties. Next to him, gripping the steering wheel, is Marion, a thirty-year-old who maneuvers the car with practiced focus. Loomis, absorbed in thought, methodically flips through the pages of a manila folder resting on his lap. As Marion drives, she momentarily shifts her attention to light a cigarette. Expertly, she strikes the match, ignites the tobacco, and then casually shoves the matches back into their pack, tossing it with a swift motion onto the dashboard where it lands with a soft thud. Loomis's gaze momentarily fixes on the tossed cigarette pack before both their attentions are drawn to the road ahead. There, by the roadside, stands a male patient, a wild-looking man in his sixties wearing a stark white gown. His eyes are fixed intently on the advancing station wagon. Observing this, Marion intuitively eases her foot off the accelerator, decelerating the vehicle and carefully maneuvering it to a halt on the roadside. Responding with urgency, Loomis springs out of the car. Through the windshield, we witness Loomis dashing over to the patient, engaging in a brief exchange of words before hastily returning to the vehicle. As the camera transitions to Laurie, it follows her as she traverses a tranquil residential street, her arms encumbered by an unwieldy bundle of school books. Simultaneously, across a backyard, young Tommy Doyleâ€”an eight-year-old boy characterized by his tousled brown hair and striking blue eyesâ€”can be seen sprinting energetically, his own books clutched tightly to his chest. He catches up to Laurie, and together, they continue their walk along the street. Their journey leads them to the front of the old, imposing two-story Myers house, which is set back discreetly from the street. Laurie pauses to hold up a key, scrutinizing it momentarily, before proceeding through the front gate and beginning her ascent towards the porch. Her steps are deliberate as she moves up the front porch, bends down to lift the welcome mat, and carefully places the key underneath. Peering in through a frosted window, we observe Laurie in the act of bending over the mat. Suddenly, a dark shape materializes, the indistinct outline of a man who leans forward silently, his gaze trained intently on her actions. As Laurie makes her way back to Tommy at the street, the figure silently retreats, blending back into the recesses of the house's interior. Laurie and Tommy resume their walk along the street, moving in tandem until Tommy breaks stride, darting across the street with youthful exuberance. Laurie continues walking, her form growing smaller as she ventures down the street, eventually disappearing in the distance. Close to the camera, the dark shape re-emerges into the frame, his eyes locked on Laurie as she rounds the corner and vanishes from sight. Meanwhile, Loomis reaches a car, smoothly unlocking it with practiced efficiency. He slides into the driver's seat, starts the engine with a decisive turn of the key, and drives away from the sanitarium. From a window, a figure identified as Wynn watches Loomis's departure, and with a quick turn, hurries back inside the building. The scene transitions to reveal Laurie seated quietly at the back of a classroom filled with high school students, her presence a calm contrast to the earlier tension.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The camera pulls back to reveal a blood-stained butcher knife in his hand as his parents transition from puzzlement to horror. The view cranes up from them to show the neighborhood, with distant police sirens rising. Two headlights cut through the rain on a lonely highway as a station wagon glides along. Inside, Marion, 30, drives with Sam Loomis, a tough-looking clinical psychiatrist in his forties, examining a manila folder. Loomis watches Marion light a cigarette and toss the matchbook onto the dashboard. They both notice a wild-looking male patient in a white gown by the road. Marion slows to a stop, allowing Loomis to jump out, speak briefly with the patient, and then return. Meanwhile, Laurie walks down a residential street carrying school books. Eight-year-old Tommy Doyle, with tousled brown hair and bright blue eyes, joins her, and they approach the old Myers house. Laurie reveals a key, walks to the porch, and places the key under the welcome mat, observed by a dark shape through the frosted window. Returning to Tommy, the shape moves back inside as they continue down the street, with Tommy eventually running off. The dark shape watches Laurie until she disappears around the corner. Loomis reaches his car, drives away from the sanitarium, and Wynn watches him leave before heading back inside. Laurie sits at the back of a high school classroom.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The camera pulls back, revealing the blood-stained butcher knife in his hand, then further back. Mother and Father stare at the POV, at first in puzzlement, then slow, growing horror. Craning up past his parents standing there, up from the neighbor's house, which was recently renovated and known for its pristine garden, to a high shot of the neighborhood as the sounds of police sirens rise in the distance. Two headlights appear in the darkness, backlighting the rain that pours down on a lonely strip of highway, infamous for numerous late-night accidents due to poor visibility. A station wagon hisses along the wet road surface. Next to her in the passenger seat is Sam Loomis, a clinical psychiatrist renowned for his controversial theories on criminal psychology. Marion, 30, drives. He is a tough-looking man in his forties who flips through pages in a manila folder containing notes on a patient he has been tracking for years. Loomis glances at Marion as she lights a cigarette from a brand recently banned in several states for health violations. She shoves the matches into the pack and tosses it on the dashboard. Loomis stares at the cigarette pack, which is cluttered with warning labels. They look up ahead. Standing by the side of the road is a male patient, a wild-looking man in his sixties who was recently reported missing from the local mental institution, dressed in a white gown, who stares at the station wagon. Marion slows the station wagon and pulls off to the side of the road. Loomis jumps out. Through the windshield we see Loomis rush over to the patient, stand and talk for a moment, then hurry back. Camera moves with Laurie as she walks down the residential street lined with cherry blossom trees, which bloom beautifully in spring. She carries a large bundle of school books in her arms, including an advanced calculus textbook. Across a backyard Tommy Doyle, an eight-year-old boy with tousled brown hair and bright blue eyes, known for his love of horror stories, comes running with his books. He catches up with her, and they walk along down the street widely regarded as the safest in town. They walk up to the front of the old, two-story Myers house, rumored among locals to be haunted, set back from the street. Laurie holds up a key which she had collected from the real estate agent earlier that morning. Laurie walks through the front gate and starts up toward the porch. Laurie strolls up to the front porch. She bends down, lifts the welcome mat, and places the key under it. Through a frost window, which distorts the view, we see Laurie bending over the welcome mat. Suddenly a dark shape, the outline of a man, leans forward, watching her closely and silently. As she walks back to Tommy at the street, the shape moves to watch them, then fades back into the interior of the house. Laurie and Tommy continue walking down the street. Tommy breaks stride and runs across the street toward his house, eager to tell his mother about his day. We see Laurie walking off down the street in the distance. Close to camera, the dark shape moves into frame, watching Laurie disappear around the corner. Loomis reaches a car and unlocks it, his trusty Ford sedan that has been with him for years. Loomis gets in the car. Loomis starts up the car and pulls away from the sanitarium known for its high-security measures. Wynn, the administrator of the institution and an old acquaintance of Loomis, watches him go, then hurries back into the building. Laurie sits at the back of a classroom of high school students, who are engrossed in a lecture about Shakespeare's tragic heroes.

Standing by the side of the road is a male patient a wildlooking man in his sixties dressed in a white gown who stares at the station wagon. Marion slows the station wagon and pulls off to the side of the road. Loomis jumps out. Through the windshield we see Loomis rush over to the patient stand and talk for a moment then hurry back. Camera moves with Laurie as she walks down the residential street. She carries a large bundle of school books in her arms. Across a backyard. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the cityâ€™s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles natureâ€™s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the cityâ€™s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles natureâ€™s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. Tommy Doyle an eightyearold boy with tousled brown hair and bright blue eyes comes running with his books. He catches up with her and they walk along down the street. They walk up to the front of the old twostory Myers house set back from the street. Laurie holds up a key. Laurie walks through the front gate and starts up toward the porch. Laurie strolls up to the front porch. She bends down lifts the welcome mat and places the key under it. Through a frost window we see Laurie bending over the welcome mat. Suddenly a dark shape the outline of a man leans forward watching her. As she walks back to Tommy at the street the shape moves to watch them then fades back into the interior of the house. Laurie and Tommy continue walking down the street. Tommy breaks stride and runs across the street. We see Laurie walking off down the street in the distance. Close to camera the dark shape moves into frame watching Laurie disappear around the corner. Loomis reaches a car and unlocks it. Loomis gets in the car. Loomis starts up the car and pulls away from the sanitarium. Wynn watches him go then hurries back into the building. Laurie sits at the back of a classroom of high school students.

Mother and Father stare at the POV at first in puzzlement then slow growing horror. Craning up past his parents standing there up from the neighbor's house to a high shot of the neighborhood as the sounds of police sirens rise in the distance. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The giraffe swings forward, revealing the ink-splattered quill in its hoof, then further forward. Teacher and Student gape at the viewpoint, at first in bewilderment, then slow, rising amusement. Stretching up past her classmates standing there, up from the gardener's shed to a wide view of the farm as the sounds of tinkling chimes grow in the breeze. Two lanterns flicker in the dusk, illuminating the smoke that drifts down on a quiet stretch of meadow. A tractor hums along the dusty path. Next to the owl in the driver's cabin is Charlie Chaplin, a forensic accountant. Wanda, 40, navigates. He is a stern-looking clown in his twenties who sketches on napkins in a leather folder. Chaplin glances at Wanda as she chews a bubblegum. She shoves the gum wrapper into the pack and flings it on the dashboard. Chaplin gazes at the gum pack. They glance up ahead. Standing by the edge of the meadow is a female acrobat, a serene-looking woman in her nineties dressed in a polka dot tutu, who gazes at the tractor. Wanda slows the tractor and drifts off to the edge of the meadow. Chaplin leaps out. Through the windshield we see Chaplin trot over to the acrobat, pirouette and charade for a moment, then skip back. Camera drifts with Steve as he jogs down the commercial avenue. He balances a small stack of comic books in his hands. Across a storefront Ricky Martin, a ten-year-old girl with curly red hair and sparkling green eyes, skips forward with her novels. She catches up with him, and they saunter along down the avenue. They approach the entrance of the new, one-story Johnson cabin set deep within the grove. Steve waves a flag. Steve strides through the wooden gate and advances up toward the pergola. Steve marches up to the pergola. He crouches down, lifts the doormat, and stashes the flag beneath it. Through a glass window, we see Steve crouching over the doormat. Suddenly a light shape, the outline of a bird, flutters upward, watching him. As he saunters back to Ricky at the avenue, the shape flits to observe them, then glides back into the interior of the shed. Steve and Ricky prance along the avenue. Ricky twirls and darts across the avenue. We observe Steve strolling off down the avenue in the distance. Close to camera, the light shape flits into frame, observing Steve vanish around the bend. Chaplin reaches a wagon and unlatches it. Chaplin hops in the wagon. Chaplin cranks up the wagon and rolls away from the circus. Holmes watches him drift, then dashes back into the tent. Steve reclines at the front of a courtyard of college professors.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The camera reveals a blood-stained butcher knife, then pulls back to show Mother and Father in growing horror, as police sirens rise in the distance. On a rainy highway, Marion drives a station wagon with psychiatrist Sam Loomis, who flips through a folder. They spot a wild-looking patient in a white gown on the roadside. Marion stops, and Loomis speaks briefly with the patient before returning to the car. Meanwhile, Laurie walks with Tommy Doyle, an eight-year-old boy, along a residential street. They approach the old Myers house, where Laurie leaves a key under the welcome mat. A dark shape watches her from inside the house. Laurie and Tommy continue walking, with the shape observing them before fading back inside. Loomis departs from the sanitarium as Laurie attends her high school class.
